History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient expressed relief after receiving constructive feedback from family, indicating a desire to improve family connections. They acknowledged feelings of anxiety about discussing deeper topics and reported feeling down due to work stress and a creative rut.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been spending quality time with family, leading to more open conversations and improved dynamics.
Risk Assessment: The patient feels anxious about initiating deeper conversations but is willing to explore strategies to address this.
Current Functional Status: The patient has been engaging in family dinners and has noticed positive changes in family interactions.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making strides in family communication and is open to trying new approaches to enhance creativity.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to use "I" statements for better communication and to set small, achievable goals for art to overcome creative blocks.
Next Steps: The patient plans to try a mixed media art piece by the next session.
